instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S5_L: What is PM_SLP_S5_L? PM_SLP_S5_L is a signal that, when 3.3v, turns on power rails that will wake the system from an S5 state. This signal is a part of the power management system of the MacBook.  The \"PM\" prefix typically stands for \"Power Management,\" and the \"SLP\" is for \"Sleep.\" The \"S5\" denotes the specific sleep state, which is Suspend to Disk, and the \"_L\" suffix indicates that this is an active low signal..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A missing <SIGNAL>P5VS4_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message: if im right i think i have to deal with the SMC because i'm missing <SIGNAL>P5VS4_EN</SIGNAL> and i don't have the <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S5_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_S4_WAKESRC_EN</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A missing <SIGNAL>P5VS4_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Probably not. Where was the liquid? Is 5VS4 pulsing after connecting power?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A missing <SIGNAL>P5VS4_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message: yes really light water damage. 5Vs4 is zero no pulsing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A missing <SIGNAL>P5VS4_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I have 3.3 v on the <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> but i don get the 5 v on the other side

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A missing <SIGNAL>P5VS4_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Read my question again and provide details.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A missing <SIGNAL>P5VS4_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message: [SIZE=14px][B]The liquid was around <CHIP>U7310</CHIP> and 5VS4 is 0v[/B][/SIZE] . <CHIP>U7310</CHIP> was shorting my <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> so after removing it  the short was gone and i replaced it with another one

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A missing <SIGNAL>P5VS4_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Dead CPU, it got 5V direct on it.
